title: BMW iX: An Electric Crossover Targeting Mainstream SUV Buyers
sub_head: Part of BMW’s new portfolio of electrified vehicles, the iX XDrive50 is aimed at the global audience for midsize SUVs. Dan Neil runs down the pros and cons.
body:
I TRAVELED to Munich last month during an uptick in the Delta variant, which required taking multiple Covid tests with those extra-long nasal swabs they use in Germany. But a chance to drive BMW ’s new iX all-electric premium crossover was nothing to sneeze at.
If (and only if) you follow the auto industry, you know that BMW’s i division was created in 2011 to develop and sell electrified mobility products to practically no one. One of the wonders of BMW-land is the Zaha Hadid-designed factory in Leipzig, where legions of robots glue and screw together the carbon-fiber-bodied i3s in sun-flooded ateliers. They really knew how to spend money back then.
